question: My grandaughter (11 mths) was diagonosed with having a low blood sugar level and a keytone level of 5. Her blood sugar is now 4.9 and her keytone level has been reduced to 1.4 after 4 days in hospital.  Is it possible to reduce the keytones to nil for the long term or will she be prone to developing juvinile diabetes?Are there any special requirements in her diet which could help eg foods which may be benificial or to avoid so she maintains the right levels to avoid long term damage?
title: keytones in infants
